domain.name: Asbestos Litigation Science
domain.description: Scientific literature relevant to asbestos-related litigation, excluding talc-contaminated products. Focused on enabling comprehensive scientific awareness for defense litigation support.

topics.name: Medical & Health Sciences
topics.description: Research on asbestos-related disease pathology, mechanisms, diagnosis, and outcomes
topics.rationale: Core medical evidence for causation arguments and disease characterization in litigation

topics.name: Exposure Science
topics.description: Methodologies and data for assessing occupational and environmental asbestos exposure
topics.rationale: Essential for establishing exposure levels and reconstruction in litigation cases

topics.name: Epidemiology
topics.description: Population-based studies examining relationships between asbestos exposure and health outcomes
topics.rationale: Foundation for risk quantification and causation arguments

topics.name: Regulatory & Standards
topics.description: Government regulations, exposure limits, and industry standards related to asbestos
topics.rationale: Establishes knowledge/awareness obligations and regulatory context for cases

topics.name: Historical Documentation
topics.description: Historical industry practices, knowledge evolution, and state-of-the-art analyses
topics.rationale: Critical for knowledge/awareness timeline arguments in litigation

topics.name: Causation & Attribution
topics.description: Methodologies and frameworks for establishing causal relationships and attribution
topics.rationale: Directly supports or challenges causation arguments in court

topics.name: Diagnostic & Biomarkers
topics.description: Methods for disease diagnosis and biomarkers for exposure or disease detection
topics.rationale: Supports differential diagnosis arguments and exposure verification

topics.name: Analytical Methods
topics.description: Fiber identification, characterization, and analytical microscopy techniques
topics.rationale: Essential for product identification and exposure characterization

topics.name: Experimental Studies
topics.description: Laboratory-based mechanistic research including animal models and in vitro studies
topics.rationale: Provides mechanistic understanding supporting causation arguments

topics.name: Reviews & Commentary
topics.description: Synthesis articles, meta-analyses, and expert commentary on asbestos research
topics.rationale: Influential summaries often cited by experts and in testimony

topics.name: Corrections & Retractions
topics.description: Corrections, retractions, and updates to previously published research
topics.rationale: High impeachment value for cross-examination of plaintiff experts

topics.name: Medicolegal Literature
topics.description: Expert testimony standards, causation frameworks, and evidentiary approaches in legal context
topics.rationale: Directly relevant to Daubert challenges and admissibility arguments

entities.name: Mesothelioma
entities.context: Primary disease outcome associated with asbestos exposure, central to litigation

entities.name: Asbestosis
entities.context: Non-malignant respiratory disease caused by asbestos exposure

entities.name: Lung Cancer
entities.context: Malignancy associated with asbestos exposure, often complicated by smoking confounding

entities.name: Pleural Disease
entities.context: Non-malignant pleural manifestations of asbestos exposure

entities.name: Asbestos
entities.context: General term for fibrous silicate minerals, central substance in litigation

entities.name: Chrysotile
entities.context: Most common form of asbestos, distinct fiber type with separate litigation implications

entities.name: Amphibole Asbestos
entities.context: Family of asbestos fiber types generally considered more potent than chrysotile

entities.name: OSHA
entities.context: Primary U.S. regulatory agency for workplace asbestos exposure standards

entities.name: EPA
entities.context: U.S. environmental regulatory agency with asbestos regulations

entities.name: Bradford Hill Criteria
entities.context: Standard framework for evaluating causation in epidemiology, frequently cited in litigation

entities.name: Permissible Exposure Limit
entities.context: OSHA regulatory standard for allowable workplace asbestos exposure

context.business_context: Defense litigation support for asbestos defendants (non-talc products) requiring comprehensive scientific awareness for case strategy, expert preparation, and Daubert challenges
context.time_sensitivity: Weekly review cadence - comprehensive awareness in less than 15 minutes per review

signal_types.name: Peer-Reviewed Research Articles
signal_types.description: Original research published in peer-reviewed scientific journals
examples: Epidemiological studies in occupational health journals

signal_types.name: Regulatory and Standards Publications
signal_types.description: Government agency publications, guidance documents, and proposed rules

signal_types.name: Expert Commentary and Editorials
signal_types.description: Opinion pieces and commentary from recognized experts

signal_types.name: Corrections and Retractions
signal_types.description: Corrections, retractions, or updates to previously published research

signal_types.name: Historical Documentation
signal_types.description: Industry documents and historical reports relevant to knowledge/awareness

signal_types.name: Medicolegal Literature
signal_types.description: Legal textbooks, practice guides, and expert testimony standards

temporal_scope.rationale: Recent research is prioritized as it reflects current scientific understanding and is more likely to be cited by plaintiff experts, but historical documentation is also critical for knowledge/awareness timeline arguments

other_criteria: Quality assessment integrated into relevance evaluation - low quality studies with impeachment value are prioritized
Corrections and retractions always included regardless of quality
Studies likely to be cited by plaintiff experts monitored regardless of quality
Comprehensive quality spectrum coverage for defensive awareness

coverage.completeness_requirement: Comprehensive coverage across full quality spectrum - includes both high-quality credible science and low-quality studies with impeachment potential. Quality assessment identifies strategic purpose rather than exclusion criteria.

inclusions.description: Asbestos or talc exposure assessment or measurement
inclusions.rationale: Core to establishing exposure levels in litigation

inclusions.description: Health effects causally or allegedly linked to asbestos or talc

inclusions.rationale: Critical for product identification and attribution
Foundation for risk assessment and causation
Critical for timeline of knowledge arguments
Directly relevant to proving or disproving causation
Supports settlement analysis and case valuation

inclusions.description: Differential diagnosis relevant to asbestos/talc exposure

inclusions.rationale: Emerging area with potential litigation impact

inclusions.description: Meta-analyses, systematic reviews, or expert commentary
inclusions.rationale: Influential syntheses often cited in testimony

inclusions.description: Corrections or retractions to prior research
Medicolegal aspects (expert testimony, causation frameworks, evidentiary standards)

exclusions.description: Legal case decisions, trial transcripts, courtroom proceedings
exclusions.rationale: Focus is on scientific literature, not legal proceedings

exclusions.description: General occupational health topics unrelated to asbestos or talc
Non-asbestos, non-talc occupational exposures (unless for comparison/context)
exclusions.rationale: Maintains focused scope on asbestos litigation
Not relevant to scientific or legal strategy

exclusions.description: Purely theoretical modeling without empirical validation
exclusions.rationale: Insufficient empirical basis for litigation use
exceptions: Novel methodological frameworks with clear applicability

exclusions.description: Duplicate publications or restatements of previously covered research
exceptions: New interpretations or analyses of same data

edge_cases.description: Studies of talc with asbestos contamination
edge_cases.conditions: Include if discussing asbestos contamination levels, fiber types, or health effects attributable to asbestos component. Exclude if purely about talc without asbestos discussion.
edge_cases.rationale: Stream focuses on asbestos, but contaminated talc is relevant when asbestos is the focus

edge_cases.description: Studies primarily about smoking but discussing asbestos interaction
edge_cases.conditions: Include if analyzing asbestos-smoking interaction, synergistic effects, or confounding adjustment. Exclude if smoking is primary focus without asbestos context.
edge_cases.rationale: Smoking confounding is critical to asbestos causation arguments

edge_cases.conditions: Include if landmark study frequently cited or if English abstract provides sufficient detail. Exclude if language barrier prevents adequate evaluation.
edge_cases.rationale: Balance comprehensiveness with practical evaluation constraints

edge_cases.conditions: Include if from reputable researchers or addressing urgent/novel topics. Flag as non-peer-reviewed. Exclude routine preprints.
edge_cases.rationale: Early awareness of significant findings while noting lack of peer review

edge_cases.description: Low-quality studies likely to be cited by plaintiff experts
edge_cases.conditions: Always include - high impeachment value regardless of quality
edge_cases.rationale: Defensive monitoring requires awareness of weak studies plaintiffs may cite

extraction_metadata.review_notes: Converted from existing stream schema and stream schema 2 JSON files. Comprehensive extraction of all scope, context, and coverage information.
